Jx.Editor

Extends: Jx.Widget

a very simplistic IFrame-based WYSIWYG editor.

Be sure that you place this editor inside a container of some sort that has at least position:relative on it.  If it doesn’t the editor will break out of the container.

Events

  • preToggleView
  • postToggleView
  • editorFocus
  • editorBlur
  • editorMouseUp
  • editorPaste
  • editorMouseEnter
  • editorClick
  • editorKeypress
  • editorKeyUp
  • editorKeyDown
  • editorCut
  • editorCopy

Copyright © 2011 by Jonathan Bomgardner Licensed under an mit-style license

Inspired by (and a great deal of code from) mooEditable

Summary
Jx.EditorExtends: Jx.Widget
Options
templateThe template to use in constructing the editor
editorCssFileThe location of a css file to use in the IFrame of the editor.
htmlThis is a string template for what will be injected into the iframe.
stylesheetTemplatea string template of the link tag used to add the editorCssFile to the html template
contentThis should contain the starting content of the editor in HTML form.
buttonsan array of arrays.
Functions
setContentUse this method to set the content of the editor.
getContentRetrieves the content of the editor.
executeMainly used by plugins to execute specific commands on the IFrame.
toggleViewThis method is used to toggle between the IFrame and the textarea views of the editor.
saveContentThis method is used to save content from the IFrame into the textarea.
resizeCall this when you need to resize the editor.
focususe this to give the editor area focus.
enableToolbarThis function is called to enable the buttons on the toolbars
disableToolbarThis function can be called to disable all buttons on a toolbar with the exception of the toggleView button.

Options

template

The template to use in constructing the editor

editorCssFile

The location of a css file to use in the IFrame of the editor.  Can be a relative or absolue path.

html

This is a string template for what will be injected into the iframe.

stylesheetTemplate

a string template of the link tag used to add the editorCssFile to the html template

content

This should contain the starting content of the editor in HTML form.

buttons

an array of arrays.  Each separate array represents the buttons (plugins) for a single toolbar.

Functions

setContent

setContent: function (content)

Use this method to set the content of the editor.  Overwrites existing content.

Parameters

content{string} the content to set

getContent

getContent: function ()

Retrieves the content of the editor.  This comes back as raw, unfiltered HTML.

execute

execute: function (command,
param1,
param2)

Mainly used by plugins to execute specific commands on the IFrame.

toggleView

toggleView: function ()

This method is used to toggle between the IFrame and the textarea views of the editor.

saveContent

saveContent: function ()

This method is used to save content from the IFrame into the textarea.

Returns

thisthe Jx.Editor instance

resize

resize: function ()

Call this when you need to resize the editor. i.e. when the layout changes or the window changes size, etc...

focus

focus: function ()

use this to give the editor area focus.

enableToolbar

enableToolbar: function ()

This function is called to enable the buttons on the toolbars

disableToolbar

disableToolbar: function ()

This function can be called to disable all buttons on a toolbar with the exception of the toggleView button.

Base class for all widgets (visual classes) in the JxLib Framework.
